Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of Mussolini's campaign to "drain the swamp" by firing more than 35,000 civil servants.
Understate: The claim may understate the extent to which Mussolini's government made a big point of draining literal swamps as public works projects.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support to conclusively prove that Mussolini used the phrase "drain the swamp" in the same context as Donald Trump.
Problematic assumption: The claim may make the problematic assumption that Mussolini's campaign to "drain the swamp" was solely aimed at ending corruption, similar to Trump's promise.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may ignore the alternative explanation that Mussolini used the concept of "draining the swamp" to apply to other areas of Italian life beyond corruption in government.
